definition: full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
15th day of month (lunar calendar)/old variant of 望[wang4]

sentences.english: You do not want to let them down...
sentences.chinese: 你的的确确不想让他们失望。

sentences.english: Learn how to handle setbacks. Life is made of ups, downs, and disappointments.
sentences.chinese: 学会如何处理挫折，生活由顺利，挫折和失望构成。

sentences.english: "We're disappointed with this result, " Vida told MUTV .
sentences.chinese: “我们对结果很失望，”维迪奇告诉曼联电视。

sentences.english: But once you get there, you're very disappointed for several reasons.
sentences.chinese: 但是一到那，你就发现有很多原因让你觉得相当失望。

sentences.english: This will disappoint Pan Qinglin, a member of the consultative committee that advises China's government.
sentences.chinese: 这必然会使政协委员潘庆林感到失望。

sentences.english: Unpractical expectations make some students disappointed in their college life.
sentences.chinese: 不切实际的期望值使部份学生对大学生活感到失望。

sentences.english: Though he had failed, he did not despond.
sentences.chinese: 他虽然失败了却没有悲观失望。

sentences.english: To be sure, Mr. Tedford's model has had its disappointments.
sentences.chinese: 当然，泰得福德的模型也曾令人失望。

sentences.english: With that he skipped even higher up the mountain while the wolf loped disappointedly away.
sentences.chinese: 山羊说完就向山上更高的地方跳去，狼失望地跑了。

sentences.english: That night, the boy couldn’t sleep for disappointment.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上，小男孩失望极了，翻来覆去怎么也睡不着。

sentences.english: This has meant disappointments and compromises that are now causing the party harm.
sentences.chinese: 这意味着失望与妥协现在正造成工党的伤害。

sentences.english: Some of you are bound to have met with disappointment in the recruiting season.
sentences.chinese: 在招聘季节中，你们当中有的人注定要与失望为伍。

sentences.english: Thank you for your giving me this opportunity, and i promise you that i wil not let you down.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢您给我这个机会，保证不会让您失望的。

sentences.english: I fully expect that SIGG will not let consumers down inthe future.
sentences.chinese: 我十分期待未来SIGG不会再让消费者失望了。

sentences.english: The Chinese team have been a disappointment, managing just one point from three games.
sentences.chinese: 国奥队令人失望，三场比赛只入一球。

definition: to lose (sth)/to drop (sth)/to feel a sense of loss/frustrated/disappointment/loss
to despair/to give up all hope/desperate/desperation
to feel sad/to feel unwell/(of life) to be difficult
to grieve/to be broken-hearted/to feel deeply hurt
to regret/to feel that it is a great pity/to feel sorry for sb
helpless/without choice/for lack of better option/grudgingly/willy-nilly/nolens volens/abbr. for 無可奈何|无可奈何[wu2 ke3 nai4 he2]
